meanings.definition: A photograph taken on a thin sheet of metal coated with a dark lacquer or enamel.
meanings.sent1: My great-grandparents showed me their old tintypes from when they were young.
meanings.sent2: The antique shop had a collection of tintypes showcasing life in the 1800s.
meanings.sent3: At the historical reenactment, the actors posed for tintypes to capture the essence of the past.
meanings.sent4: The tintypes on the wall seemed to whisper stories of bygone eras.
meanings.sent5: The tintypes gleamed with a mysterious charm, frozen moments in time.

meanings.definition: A photograph taken on a thin sheet of metal coated with a dark lacquer or enamel, typically in the 19th century.
meanings.sent1: The museum displayed tintypes that offered a glimpse into life in the 1800s.
meanings.sent2: During the Victorian era, tintypes were a popular way to capture memories.
meanings.sent3: The artist used modern technology to create tintypes with a vintage flair.
meanings.sent4: In the old saloon, the tintypes on the walls added a touch of nostalgia.
meanings.sent5: The tintypes reflected the faces of people long gone, frozen in time.
